author: protolambda
content: With all due respect <@!527027407228502037>, I think it's very valuable to just keep on focusing on tech for at least the next few weeks. We almost reached 5 clients on the same testnet, and dev iteration like this is important. author: protolambda
content: Although this discord has grown to function as more than just a research/dev channel, its primary purpose is still R&D, and I feel like in this stage governance is a distraction. I think an incentivized testnet would be the turning point, where we should be including governance, but not right now.

author: djrtwo
content: and even then, maybe that should happen in a different discord. one setup specifically for testnet participants

author: protolambda
content: Yes, we could have discord bots helping with common testnet tasks and data, we can have focused introduction/newbie channels, we could have channels to track testing/participation/3rd party tools. Kind of what Prysm had to extend their discord with after they grew so large. Managing a lot of users and governance is difficult, and noisy for developers at best. I very much appreciate users and governance, but extending this R&D discord right now would hurt Eth2 more than it would help any kind of decision making process. That said, there are many other channels, and if there's a need for it right now, those could be used.
